chapter.title: Graphical Process Designer (GPD)
chapter.para: This chapter will explain how to work with the Graphical Process Designer. After installing the GPD and setting up the examples, you'll see that the jPDL process files will get a special icon. Double clicking such a file in the package view will open up the jPDL process in the GPD.

section.title: Creating a new process file
section.para: CRTL+N will open up the wizard selector.
Select jBPM --> jPDL 4 File. Click 'Next >'. Then the 'New jPDL 4 File' wizard opens.
Select the parent directory, enter a file name and click 'Finish'. Voila, you've created your first jPDL process file.

section.title: Editing the process source
section.para: The GPD contains a 'Source' tab with the XML sources. These are directly editable in this tab and the graphical view will reflect the changes when you switch back to the diagram.
